content.description:
All the holds are good, the rocks pretty sharp, and just like

Getup to Warm-up

don't go past the jug sidepull at the top. That hold is on though.
content.location:
Sit start with both of your hands anywhere in the lowest crack, and go up following

Getup to Warm-up

.

content.description: Moving from the start to the crimp seem is chill. I thought the crux was moving from there up to the jug sidepull. Just make sure to to cross it and end up on the left side.
content.location: Start on the middle crack. Don't start all the way on the bottom of it. You should be on the right side of the jug sidepull at the top.

content.description:
Move from the start, and veer right moving straight up, but don't pass the huge sidepull at the top of boulder (it's obvious).

Descend off the backside of the boulder.
content.location: Start with a good left hand sidepull on the arete and your right hand in the top of the lowest crack.

content.description:
Start just left of the arete with your right hand on the left starting hold of

Getup To Warmup

and your left hand on another decent edge right next to it. Work straight up the face, a two-move wonder. A harder version seems to go with your right hand on the original left starting hold, but I haven't been able to do it.
content.location: It is on the north face of the boulder (around the left corner from the other problems).
